Display the average and std-dev in x (green) and y (red) of a curve.
Red: right: on all data.  left: only on defined (i.e. non-zero) data.

SPACE to erase.  Presets: 1,2,3

name: change blindness: look for it:-)
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
mouse controls camera
inspiration: https://twitter.com/social_brains/status/1518786027288104960
image_code:
#define rot(a)        mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))            // rotation 2D
#define r(a)          cos(a+vec2(0,11))                       // unit vector in dir a

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t=9., a, A, d,i, PI2 = 6.28,
         da = PI2/7., T = mod(iTime,PI2+da), B = T-PI2;       // animation cycle : danse & shift
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(vec3(U+U, -3.5*R.y) - R),             // ray direction
          p = 7./R, q,                                        // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? iMouse.xyz/R -.5: vec3(0);      // mouse control of camera
     
    for (O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.01) {
        q = p,
        q.yz *= rot(.5-6.*M.y),                               // camera rotations
        q.xz *= rot(2.-6.*M.x);
        for (a = 0.; a < 7.; a++ )                            // --- draw 7 spheres
            A = da*a - da*smoothstep(0.,da,B),                // direction of each sphere
            d = length( q - vec3( 1.5*r( A )                  // spread & shift
                                 - .2*r( A + PI2*sin(B<0.?T:0.)) ,0).xzy  // danse
                      ) - .3,
            d < t ? t=d, i=a : t;                             // keep closest sphere
        p += .2*t*D;                                          // step forward = dist to closest obj          
   }                                                          // --- color scheme
   O *=  O * ( 1. + cos( da*(i - T/(PI2+da) )  + vec4(0,23,21,0)  ) ) / .8; // hue(i+slow shift)
}

name: visual shepard tone
author: mmalex
description: sorry for the misspelling and thanks @fabriceneyret2 for the correction! shepard, not shepherd: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shepard_tone
image_code:
void mainImage( out vec4 f, in vec2 c ){ vec2 uv = c/iResolution.xy;float
t=fract(iTime),col=0.;for (float oct=0.;oct<4.;++oct) col+=((oct==0.)?t:(
oct==3.)?1.-t:1.)*texture(iChannel0,(uv.xy-0.5)*exp2(t+oct)+(floor(iTime)
-oct+4.)*vec2(23.4353,75.3456)).x;f=vec4(vec3(sqrt(col*0.25)),1.);}

name: oblique relief (terrain tilted z
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
For panorama depiction you sometime want 3D view but with mountains still looking quite like they are from the floor.
left: classical rotated camera    right: with tilted terrain
mouse.y controls camera angle.    mouse.x select render mode (red separator)
image_code:
// ref: http://www.reliefshading.com/design/plan-oblique-relief/

#define rot(a)    mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))          // rotation 2D
#define T(U,l)    textureLod( iChannel0, U/S +.2, l ).r // terrain

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 u)
{
    float t=9., S=4.;                                   // texture scaling
    vec2  R  = iResolution.xy,
          U  = ( 2.*u - R )/R.y,                        // normalized screen coords
          M  = iMouse.z > 0. ? ( 2.*iMouse.xy - R*vec2(1,2) ) / R.y 
                             : vec2(cos(iTime),-.14-.7+.7*sin(0.74*iTime)); // auto-demo
    vec3  D  = normalize(vec3(U, -3.5)),                // ray direction
          p0 = vec3(0,0,7), p=p0, q;                    // marching point along ray 

    for (int i=0; i<200 && t > .01; i++) {              // --- ray marching loop
        q = p;
        if (U.x < M.x) 
              q.yz *=  rot(-M.y);                       // left: classical rotation
        else  q.y += q.z * -M.y;                        // right: terrain tilting
     //  q.yz *= rot(.14);                              // rotation
        t = q.y - .2 *S*T(q.xz,0.) +.3,                 // terrain pseudo-SDF
        p += .3*t*D;                                    // step forward = dist to obj          
   }
   t = length(p-p0)-2.; O = vec4( exp(-t/10.) );        // depth-shading
   t = T(q.xz,0.);                                      // final look:
   O *= ( 1. + 100.*(t-T(q.xz,1.)) ) * (.2+t);          // add details + ambient occlusion
   
  if ( abs(U.x-M.x)*R.y < 1.5 ) O = vec4(1,0,0,1);      // red separator
}

name: paint with deformations
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
paint deformations with mouse. 
- click and drag: displace. 
- LEFT/RIGHT keys + click or click&drag: rotate to left or right.
- UP/DOWN keys + click or click&drag:  grow/shrink.
- DEL: undo
- rewind: reset

#define R      iResolution.xy
#define T(U)   texelFetch( iChannel0, ivec2(U), 0 )

#define N 2.   // N² undo levels

name: the sad fate of sharpness in CG
author: FabriceNeyret2
description:
on still image you can reach the maximum screen sharpness.
But if you want to allow free trans, rot, scal, persp, then antialiasing limit you to half resol.
Top: image Bot: strips = 1 or 2 pix
Left: exact match. Mid: 1/2 pix offset.  Right: offs= fract(t)

name: Volume Scattering by LinusDev
author: Pro_Coder
description: Volume Scattering in "real time"
common_code:
/*
 *
 *
 * Volume Scattering
 *
 *
 */
#define VOLUME_MAX_STEP_DISTANCE 0.05


#define CONSTANT_ANT

#ifdef CONSTANT_ANT
    #define ABSOPRTION_C(POS, DIR) (vec3(0.1))
    #define SCATTERING_C(POS, DIR) (vec3(0.5))
    #define ADD_EMISSION(POS, DIR) (vec3(0.1))
#else
    #define ABSOPRTION_C(POS, DIR) (vec3(0.0))
    #define SCATTERING_C(POS, DIR) (noise(iChannel0, POS*.15).rrr*1.5)
    #define ADD_EMISSION(POS, DIR) (noise(iChannel0, POS*.15).rrr*.4)
#endif



#define HG_G 0.0


/*
 *
 *
 * World Stuff
 *
 *
 */
#define UP_VECTOR vec3(0., 1., 0.)

#define CAM_START_POS vec3(0., 3., 4.)
#define CAM_START_DIS_TO_SCREEN 1.
#define CAM_START_LOOK_AT_POSITION vec3(0., 3., 0.)

/*
 *
 *
 * Constants
 *
 *
 */
#define PI 3.14
#define NO_HIT_ID 0u
#define RENDER_DISTANCE 100.0
#define MIN_DISTANCE 0.001
//#define MAX_STEPS 1000u
//better max steps by @morimea
#define MAX_STEPS (1000u+uint(1-min(iFrame+1,1)))

#define BOX_POSITION vec3(sin(iTime), 5., 0.)
#define BOX_SIZE vec3(0.5)

#define VOLUME_POSITION vec3(0., 3., 0.)
#define VOLUME_SIZE vec3(4., 5.8, 2.)

//#define LIGHT_SOURCE_POSITION vec3(0., 3.*sin(iTime*.5+PI*.5) + 6., 0.)
#define LIGHT_SOURCE_POSITION vec3(0., 9., 0.)
#define LIGHT_SOURCE_RADIUS 0.0
#define LIGHT_SOURCE_LIGHT (vec3(1., 1. , 1.)*20.)
#define LIGHT_SOURCE_ID 1u

/*
 *
 *
 * Vars
 *
 *
 */
#define DO_SAVE(texel) (ivec2(fragCoord) == texel)
#define GET(buffer, texel) (texelFetch(buffer, texel, 0))

#define CAM_POS_TEXEL   ivec2(0, 0)
#define VIEW_DIR_TEXEL  ivec2(0, 1)

/*
 *
 *
 * Functions
 *
 *
 */
 
float vmax(vec3 a){
    return max(a.z, max(a.x, a.y));
} 

//dirLight -> normalized direction to the light source
//dirRefle -> the reflection direction we care about
float henyeyGreenstein(float g, vec3 dirLight, vec3 dirRefle)
{
    return (1.0 - g * g) / (12.56637061436 * pow(1. + g * g - 2. * g * dot(-dirLight, dirRefle), 1.5));
}

vec4 noise(sampler2D tex, vec3 pos) {
    return pow(textureLod(tex, pos.xz, 0.0) * textureLod(tex, pos.xy, 0.0) * textureLod(tex, pos.zy, 0.0), vec4(1.3));
}

Gauss approx variant of https://shadertoy.com/view/Xty3zc
star = 0-size point
star appear on sensor as Airy disk smoothed by pixel resol. Here, (huge) approx as Gaussian for close form integrals.
top: lum = 10⁵ ^ x
bottom: star dist * x for lum 10¹ & 10²

name: Reproject Web Mercator
author: venus
description: Reproject Web Mercator to Geographic。Web Mercator 投影的特点是靠近极地地方占比大，靠近赤道的地方占比小，所以高纬度的地方看起来就显得面积比较大，比如格陵兰岛和南极洲，或者导致俄罗斯看起来比非洲还大。所以，为了把 Web Mercator 转换为 Geographic（Equirectangular projection），在输入是均匀的 UV 情况下，就需要反过来，导致结果看起来是靠近极地地方占比小，靠近赤道的地方占比大

name: Mandelbrot Set - distance
author: iq
description: Two distance estimators for the Mandelbrot Set. ESTIMATOR 0 is the one most people use to raymarch quaternionic quadratic sets (like Mandelbrot or Julia set). ESTIMATOR 1 is however a MUCH better estimator and no much more expensive.

name: Banded mosaic
author: jarble
description:
A simple mosaic pattern.
Click and drag to move around.
common_code:
#define fmod3(a,b) mod(floor(a) + floor((a)/2.)*2.+floor((a)/4.)*4.+floor((a)/8.)*8.+floor((a)/16.)*16.,b)
#define fmod2(x,y) mod(floor(y*((x)/y+floor((x)/y)/y)),y)
#define fmod1(x,y) mod(floor(x),y)
#define fmod(x,y) max(mod(floor(x+floor(t0/y)),y),fmod1(x,y))
//#define fmod(a,b) mod(mod(floor((a)),floor(1.+(a)/3.)),b)
#define fmax(x,y,z) max(fmod(x,z),fmod(y,z))
#define fpow(x,y) pow(y,mod(floor(x),y))
#define floor1(x) floor(x)*floor(mod((x)/4.,2.))
